intro: Senecio alpicola, commonly known as the alpine senecio, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
